organization.fullName: Hospital for Special Surgery, New York

identificationModule.briefTitle: Preoperative Oral Hydration in the Ambulatory Arthroplasty Population
identificationModule.officialTitle: Preoperative Oral Hydration in the Ambulatory Arthroplasty Population :A Single-Blinded Randomized Control Trial

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: Hospital for Special Surgery, New York

leadSponsor.name: Hospital for Special Surgery, New York

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to investigate if the consumption of a complex carbohydrate drink preoperatively, decreases the length of stay and causes for failure to launch in patients undergoing ambulatory total joint arthroplasty.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The way total joint arthroplasty is practiced continues to evolve as CMS removed total hip arthroplasty (THA) from the inpatient-only list and added total knee arthroplasty (TKA) to the ASC Covered Surgical Procedures List (CPL) in 2020. Thus, surgeons must find subtle interventions that improve patient outcomes while minimizing the risk of adverse reactions. Current literature has not assessed the influence of preoperative hydration, using a complex carbohydrate drink, on the same-day discharge rate and causes for failure to launch. Considering variabilities in perioperative fluid management leading to postoperative nausea, vomiting, and dizziness, the investigators seek to reduce the incidence of these events by optimizing patients using a preoperative oral hydration protocol, reducing the length of stay, and improving same-day discharge rates.

armGroups.label: Complex Carbohydrate Drink Group
armGroups.description: The patients will drink a 400ml drink that contains 50g of complex carbohydrates, 3 hours prior to the surgery. The drink will be given once at the preoperative holding area. Patients are not allowed to eat solid foods after 12am the morning of surgery and can only drink clear fluids up to 3 hours prior to the surgery.

armGroups.label: No-Complex Carbohydrate Drink Group
armGroups.description: These patients will follow normal institutional preoperative fluid management guidelines, this consist of no solid foods after 12am the morning of surgery. Patients are allowed to drink clear liquids (water, clear fruit juices, coffee) from 12am the morning of surgery up to 3 hours prior to the surgery.

interventions.name: Complex Carbohydrate Drink
interventions.description: Patients will drink a complex carbohydrate drink 3 hours before surgery. Drink to be given at the preoperative holding area.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Length of hospital stay in hours
primaryOutcomes.description: Length of hospital stay in hours, assess by medical record.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From admission to discharge, up to 1 week

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of patients discharged successfully the day of surgery.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 3 months.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of physical therapy sessions attempted
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of physical therapy sessions attempted, assess by medical record.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From admission to discharge, up to 1 week.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Total distance walked during physical therapy attempts, assess by medical record.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From admission to discharge, up to 1 week.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of stairs climbed during physical therapy attempts, assess by medical record.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From admission to discharge, up to 1 week.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Orthostatic hypotension episodes during physical therapy attempts, assess by medical record.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During physical therapy attempts, from admission to discharge.

secondaryOutcomes.description: This is a 6-item questionnaire that assesses patient-reported hip pain and function. Score ranges from 0-100, with 100 representing the best possible score.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The morning of surgery and at the first post-operative visit, up to 4 months post-op.

secondaryOutcomes.description: This is a 6-item questionnaire that assesses patient reported knee pain and function. Score ranges from -100, with 100 representing the best score possible.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The morning of surgery and at the first post-operative visit, up to 4 months post-op.

secondaryOutcomes.description: The VR-12 is a 12-item self-reported questionnaire that assesses the patient physical and mental quality of life.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: The morning of surgery and at the first post-operative visit, up to 4 months post-op.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Urine osmolality taken preoperatively, assess by medical record.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured preoperatively the morning of surgery.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Urine specific gravity preoperatively, assess by medical record.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured preoperatively the morning of surgery.

secondaryOutcomes.description: In-house costs taking into account cost of complex carbohydrate drink vs previously published costs savings per night of stay.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From admission to discharge, up to 1 week.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Candidates for ambulatory total knee arthroplasty
* Candidates for ambulatory total hip arthroplasty
* Candidates for ambulatory revision knee arthroplasty (liner exchange only)
* Candidates for ambulatory revision hip arthroplasty (liner exchange only)
* Case scheduled before noon (12 pm)
* Patient agrees to same-day discharge and has a responsible adult to spend the night on the day of discharge

Exclusion Criteria:

* BMI less than 18.5 or greater than 37.0
* Patients with diabetes, chronic kidney disease, clotting disorders, or neurological conditions preventing control of the affected limb.
* Pregnant women
* Patients scheduled as ambulatory due to insurance mandates
* Patients with a history of active ischemia, significant valvular disease, significant arrhythmias, obstructive sleep apnea as per Hospital for Special Surgery guidelines, chronic opioid dependence (chronic daily opioid use for six or more months), and glomerular filtration rate \< 60ml/min.
